revised_title: Electronic States of Composite Systems: A New Approach to Weak Interactions
tldr: This article presents a new approach to understanding the electronic states of composite systems by introducing the electric density operator. The author shows that in the absence of electron exchange, matrix elements of the interaction between subsystems can be accurately expressed as electrostatic repulsion energies between electric distributions localized on subsystems. This concept simplifies the problem of weak interactions and provides a general understanding of phenomena such as quasi-classical forces, inductive interactions, dispersion forces, and resonance forces.
